article.title: Debian
article.paragraph: Debian(IPAc-enˈdɛbiən)is aUnix-likecomputeroperating systemand aLinux distributionthat is composed entirely offree and open-source software, most of which is under theGNU General Public License, and packaged by a group of individuals known as the Debian Project. Three main branches are offered:Stable,TestingandUnstable.

The DebianStabledistribution is one of the most popular forpersonal computersandnetwork servers, and has been used as a base for several other Linux distributions. The DebianTestingandUnstablebranches arerolling releaseand eventually become thestabledistribution after development and testing (UnstablebecomesTesting, andTestingbecomesStable).

Debian was first announced in 1993 byIan Murdock, and the first stable release was made in 1996. The development is carried out over the Internet by a team of volunteers guided by a project leader and three foundational documents: theDebian Social Contract, the Debian Constitution, and theDebian Free Software Guidelines. New distributions are updated continually, and the next candidate is released after a time-basedFreeze (software engineering)freeze.

As one of the earliest Linux distributions, it was envisioned that Debian was to be developed openly in the spirit of theGNU Project. This vision drew the attention and support of theFree Software Foundation, which sponsored the project for one year from November 1994 to November 1995.cite webhttps://www.debian.org/doc/manuals/project-history/ch-detailed.en.htmlA Brief History of Debian – A Detailed HistoryOctober 13, 2015Upon the ending of the sponsorship, the Debian project formed the non-profit organisationSoftware in the Public Interest.
article.heading: Features

link.part: Graphical version of the Debian Installer

article.paragraph: Debian has access to online repositories that contain over 43,000Package (package management system)software packages.cite webDebian//www.debian.org/2015-04-26DebianDebian officially contains only free software, but non-free software can be downloaded from the Debian repositories and installed.cite web//www.debian.org/distrib/packagesDebian - PackagesDebian2014-06-22Debian includes popular free programs such asLibreOffice,cite web//www.debian.org/News/2011/20110623Debian Moves to LibreOfficeDebian2012-03-05Mozilla Corporation software rebranded by the Debian projectIceweasel (Firefox)web browser,Evolution (software)Evolutionmail,K3bdisc burner,VLC media player,GIMPimage editor andEvincedocument viewer.Debian is a popular choice forweb servers.cite webhttp://www.pcworld.com/article/247845/debian_linux_named_most_popular_distro_for_web_servers.htmlDebian Linux Named Most Popular Distro for Web ServersNoyesKatherine[[PC World]]2012-01-112013-02-14cite webhttp://w3techs.com/technologies/details/os-linux/all/allUsage statistics and market share of Linux for websitesW3Techs.com2014-06-10

The cost of developing all of the packages included in Debian 5.0 Lenny (323 million lines of code) has been estimated to be aboutUS$ 8 billionyes, using one method based on theCOCOMOmodel.cite web2014-05-25http://gsyc.es/~frivas/paper.pdfMeasuring Lenny: the size of Debian 5.0Francisco RivasAs of2014,Ohlohestimates that thecodebase(78 million lines of code) would cost aboutUS$ 1.5 billionto develop, using a different method based on the same model.cite webhttps://www.openhub.net/p/debian/estimated_costEstimated Cost[[Ohloh]]2014-07-05cite webhttps://packages.debian.org/stable/ohcountPackage: ohcount (3.0.0-6.1)Debian2014-07-05

The current stable release, Debian 8.2 code-named Jessie, is officially supported on ten#Architecture_portsarchitecture ports.cite web//www.debian.org/releases/jessie/releasenotesDebian GNU/Linux 8.0: Release Notes2015-04-26DebianNotable changes in this release include usingsystemdas the defaultinitsystem.
article.heading: Kernels
article.paragraph: Debian supportsLinuxofficially, offeredDebian GNU/kFreeBSDkFreeBSDfor version 7 but not 8,cite web//www.debian.org/releases/wheezy/i386/release-notes/ch-whats-new.htmlRelease Notes for Debian 7.0 (wheezy), 32-bit PCChapter 2. What's new in Debian 7.0Debian2014-05-27andGNU Hurdunofficially.cite web//www.debian.org/ports/hurd/Debian GNU/HurdDebian2014-05-012014-06-10GNU/kFreeBSD was released as a technology preview forIA-32andx86-64computer architecturearchitectures,and lacked the amount of software available in Debian's Linux distribution.cite webhttps://release.debian.org/wheezy/arch_qualify.htmlarchitecture requalification status for wheezyDebian2014-08-15Official support for kFreeBSD was removed for version 8, which did not provide a kFreeBSD-based distribution.

There are several flavors of the Linux kernel for each port; for instance, the i386 port has flavors for IA-32IBM PC compatiblePCssupportingPhysical Address Extensionandreal-time computing, for older PCs, and for x86-64 PCs.cite webhttps://packages.debian.org/wheezy/linux-imageVirtual Package: linux-imageDebian2014-08-15The Linux kernel does not officially containfirmwarewithout sources, although such firmware is available in non-free packages and alternative installation media.cite webhttps://kernel-handbook.alioth.debian.org/ch-source.htmlDebian Linux Kernel HandbookChapter 2 - Debian kernel source[[Alioth (Debian)|Alioth]]2013-12-142014-08-15cite webhttp://cdimage.debian.org/cdimage/unofficial/non-free/cd-including-firmware/Unofficial non-free CDs including firmware packagesDebian2014-08-16
article.heading: Installation and Live images
article.paragraph: Debian offers DVD and CDISO imageimagesfor installation that can be downloaded usingBitTorrent (protocol)BitTorrentorjigdo. Physical disks can also be bought from retailers.cite web//www.debian.org/CD/Debian on CDsDebian2014-05-102014-05-27The full sets are made up of several discs (the amd64 port consists of 10 DVDs or 69 CDs),cite web//www.debian.org/CD/jigdo-cd/#whichDownloading Debian CD images with jigdoDebian2014-05-102014-05-26but only the first disc is required for installation, as the installer can retrieve software not contained in the first disc image from online repositories.cite web//www.debian.org/CD/http-ftp/#stableDownloading Debian CD/DVD images via HTTP/FTPDebian2014-05-172014-05-26

Debian offers different network installation methods. A minimal install of Debian is available via the "netinst" CD, whereby Debian is installed with just a base and later additional software can be downloaded from the Internet. Another option is to boot the installer from the network.cite web//www.debian.org/distrib/netinstInstalling Debian GNU/Linux via the InternetDebian2008-12-11

Installation images areHybrid dischybridon some architectures and can be used to create abootingbootableUSB drive (Live USB).cite web//www.debian.org/releases/squeeze/amd64/ch04s03.html#usb-copy-isohybridDebian GNU/Linux Installation Guide4.3. Preparing Files for USB Memory Stick BootingDebian20102014-05-27

The default desktop may be chosen from the DVD boot menu amongGNOME,KDE Software Compilation,XfceandLXDE, and from special disc 1 CDs.cite web//www.debian.org/releases/wheezy/i386/ch06s03.html.enDebian GNU/Linux Installation Guide6.3. Using Individual ComponentsDebian2013//web.archive.org/web/20131224224113/http://www.debian.org/releases/wheezy/i386/ch06s03.html.en2013-12-242014-05-30cite webhttp://www.zdnet.com/debian-linux-7-0-wheezy-hands-on-7000015889/Debian Linux 7.0 Wheezy: Hands onWatsonJ.A.[[ZDNet]]2013-05-282014-06-10For the CD images, it is useful to know that Debian supports a number of different desktops, including Gnome, KDE, Xfce and LXDE, and there is a different 'disk 1' image for each of these desktops.
article.heading: Desktop environments

link.target: File:Docky on Gnome Shell of Gnome 3, Debian GNU-Linux.png
link.part: dockyon Gnome Shell of Gnome 3, Debian GNU/Linux

article.paragraph: Debian offers CD images specifically built for GNOME (the default in Wheezy), KDE Software Compilation, Xfce and LXDE.cite webDebian 6.0 'Squeeze' releasedDebian//www.debian.org/News/2011/20110205a2011-02-062011-02-06MATE (desktop environment)MATEis officially supported,cite webhttps://packages.debian.org/wheezy-backports/mate-desktopPackage: mate-desktop (1.8.1+dfsg1-1~bpo70+1)2014-07-06DebianwhileCinnamon (software)Cinnamonsupport was added with Debian 8.0 Jessie.Cite webDebian -- Details of package cinnamon in jessiehttps://packages.debian.org/en/jessie/cinnamonpackages.debian.org2015-09-06Less commonwindow managerssuch asEnlightenment (window manager)Enlightenment,Openbox,Fluxbox,IceWM,Window Makerand others are available.cite webhttps://packages.debian.org/sid/x-window-managerVirtual Package: x-window-managerDebian2014-05-27

The default desktop environment of version 7.0 Wheezy was temporarily switched to Xfce, because GNOME 3 did not fit on the first CD of the set.cite web//www.phoronix.com/scan.php?pageLarabelMichaelMichael LarabelDebian Now Defaults To Xfce Desktop[[Phoronix]]2012-08-082012-08-27The default for the version 8.0 Jessie was changed again to Xfce in November 2013,cite webhttp://linux.softpedia.com/blog/Debian-8-0-quot-Jessie-quot-Ditches-GNOME-and-Adopts-Xfce-397262.shtmlDebian 8.0 'Jessie' Ditches GNOME and Adopts XfceStahieSilviu[[Softpedia]]2013-11-052014-11-22and back to GNOME in September 2014.cite webhttps://anonscm.debian.org/cgit/tasksel/tasksel.git/commit/?idswitch default desktop to GnomeHessJoey[[Alioth (Debian)|Alioth]]2014-09-192014-11-03
article.heading: Debian Live
article.paragraph: Debian releaseslive CDlive installimages for CDs, DVDs and USB thumb drives, forIA-32andx86-64architectures, and with a choice of desktop environments. These "Debian Live" images allow the user to boot from removable media and run Debian without affecting the contents of their computer.
A full install of Debian to the computer's hard drive can be initiated from the live image environment.cite web//www.debian.org/CD/live/Live install images2013-10-272013-12-07Debian

Personalized images can be built with the live-build tool for discs, USB drives and fornetwork bootingpurposes.cite webhttp://live.debian.net/manual/stable/html/live-manual.en.htmlDebian Live ManualDebian20132014-07-06
article.heading: Package management
article.paragraph: Package management systemPackage managementoperations can be performed with different tools available on Debian, from the lowest level commandemdpkgto graphical front-ends like Synaptic. The recommended standard for administering packages on a Debian system is theemapttoolset.cite web//www.debian.org/doc/manuals/debian-reference/ch02.en.htmlDebian ReferenceChapter 2. Debian package managementDebian2013-12-032014-05-29

dpkgprovides the low-level infrastructure for package management.cite webhttps://packages.debian.org/stable/dpkgPackage: dpkg (1.16.15) [security] [essential]Debian2014-06-18The dpkg database contains the list of installed software on the current system. The dpkg command tool does not know about repositories. The command can work with localdeb (file format).debpackage files as well as information from the dpkg database.cite webhttp://manpages.debian.org/cgi-bin/man.cgi?querydpkgDebian2012-06-052014-06-18
article.heading: APT tools
article.paragraph: File:Debian 7 Aptitude Package Details.pngthumbUsing Aptitude to view Debian package detailsFile:Debian-aptitude.pngthumbPackage installed with AptitudeAnAdvanced Packaging ToolAPTtool allows administration of an installed Debian system for retrieving and resolving packageCoupling (computer programming)dependenciesfromSoftware repositoryrepositories. APT tools share dependency information and cached packages.

list.listitem: aptitude (software)Aptitudeis acommand linetool that also offers aText-based user interfaceTUIinterface. The program comes with enhancements such as better search on packagemetadata.

emapt-getandemapt-cacheare command tools of the standardAdvanced Packaging Tool#Usageaptpackage. apt-get installs and removes packages, and apt-cache is used for searching packages and displaying package information.

article.heading: AnchorGDEBIGDebi and other front-ends
article.paragraph: GDebiis an APT tool which can be used in command-line and on the GUI.cite webhttps://launchpad.net/gdebi/gdebi[[Launchpad (website)|Launchpad]]2014-06-19GDebi can install a local .deb file via the command line like the dpkg command, but with access to repositories to resolve dependencies.cite webhttp://www.pcworld.com/article/163019/ubuntu_tricks.html10 Expert Ubuntu TricksThomasKeirKeir Thomas[[PC World]]2009-04-132014-06-19Other graphical front-ends for APT includeUbuntu Software CenterSoftware Center,cite webhttps://packages.debian.org/stable/software-centerPackage: software-center (5.1.2debian3.1)Debian2014-06-19Synaptic (software)Synapticcite webhttps://packages.debian.org/stable/synapticPackage: synaptic (0.75.13)Debian2014-06-19andApper.cite webhttps://packages.debian.org/stable/apperPackage: apper (0.7.2-5)Debian2014-06-19
article.heading: Branches
article.paragraph: ThreeBranching (revision control)branchesof Debian (also calledemreleases,emdistributionsoremsuites) are regularly maintained:cite webDebian Releases//www.debian.org/releases/Debian2014-06-22

list.listitem: Stableis the current release and targets stable and well-tested software needs.cite webhttp://www.zdnet.com/the-new-debian-linux-7-0-is-now-available-7000014911/The new Debian Linux 7.0 is now availableVaughan-NicholsSteven J.[[ZDNet]]2013-05-052014-07-08Stableis made by freezingTestingfor a few months where bugs are fixed and packages with too many bugs are removed; then the resulting system is released asStable. It is updated only if major security or usability fixes are incorporated.This branch has an optionalBackportingbackportsservice that provides more recent versions of some software.cite web//www.debian.org/News/2010/20100905Backports service becoming officialDebian2010-09-052014-06-17Stable's CDs and DVDs can be found in the Debian website.

Testingis the preview branch that will eventually become the next major release. The packages included in this branch have had some testing inUnstablebut they may not be fit for release yet. It contains newer packages thanStablebut older thanUnstable. This branch is updated continually until it is frozen.Testing's CDs and DVDs can be found on the Debian website.

Unstable, always codenamedSid, is theTrunk (software)trunk. Packages are accepted without checking the distribution as a whole.This branch is usually run by software developers who participate in a project and need the latest libraries available, and by those who preferBleeding edge technologybleeding-edgesoftware.Debian does not provide Sid installation discs. This branch can be installed through a system upgrade fromTesting.cite web//www.debian.org/CD/faq/#unstable-imagesFrequently Asked QuestionsDebian2014-07-09

article.paragraph: Other branches in Debian:

list.listitem: Oldstableis the priorStablerelease.It is supported by the Debian Security Team until one year after a newStableis released, and since the release of Debian 6, for an additional 2 years through the Long Term Support project.Eventually,Oldstableis moved to a repository for archived releases.
Oldoldstableis the priorOldstablerelease. It is supported by the Long Term Support community. Eventually,Oldoldstableis moved to a repository for archived releases.

Experimentalis a temporary staging area of highly experimental software that is likely to break the system. It is not a full distribution and missing dependencies are commonly found inUnstable, where new software without the damage chance is normally uploaded.

article.paragraph: Theemsnapshotarchive provides older versions of the branches. They may be used to install a specific older version of some software.cite webhttp://snapshot.debian.org/snapshot.debian.orgDebian2014-07-09
article.heading: Numbering scheme
article.paragraph: StableandOldstableget minor updates, calledempoint releases;as of201509y, theStablerelease is version 8.2,and theOldstablerelease is version 7.9.

The numbering scheme for the point releases up to Debian 4.0 was to include the letterr(forrevision)after the main version number and then the number of the point release; for example, the latest point release of version 4.0 is 4.0r9.cite webhttp://archive.debian.org/debian/dists/Debian-4.0/ReleaseReleaseetchDebian2010-05-222014-06-05This scheme was chosen because a new dotted version would make the old one look obsolete and vendors would have trouble selling their CDs.cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-devel/1998/08/msg01581.htmlNaming of new 2.0 releaseSchulzeMartindebian-develDebian1998-08-242014-07-26

From Debian 5.0, the numbering scheme of point releases was changed, conforming to the GNU version numbering standard;cite webhttps://www.gnu.org/prep/standards/html_node/Releases.html#index-version-numbers_002c-for-releasesGNU Coding Standards: Releases[[GNU]]2014-05-132014-05-25You should identify each release with a pair of version numbers, a major version and a minor. We have no objection to using more than two numbers, but it is very unlikely that you really need them.the first point release of Debian 5.0 was 5.0.1 instead of 5.0r1.cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-devel-announce/2009/02/msg00003.htmlMarcBrockschmidt2009-02-152009-02-15debian-devel-announceDebian squeeze waiting for developmentDebianThe numbering scheme was once again changed for the first Debian 7 update, which was version 7.1.Therscheme is no longer in use, but point release announcements include a note about not throwing away old CDs.cite web//www.debian.org/News/2014/20141018Updated Debian 7: 7.7 releasedDebian2014-10-182014-10-20
article.heading: Code names
article.paragraph: The code names of Debian releases arelist of Toy Story charactersnames of charactersfrom theToy Story (franchise)Toy Storyfilms. Debian 8 was named Jessie, after theJessie (Toy Story)cowgirlinToy Story 2andToy Story 3. TheTestingbranch is currently named Stretch, after theStretch (Toy Story)toy rubber octopusinToy Story 3. TheUnstabletrunk is permanently nicknamedSid (Toy Story)Sid, after the emotionally unstableboy next doorwho regularly destroyed toys.cite web//www.debian.org/doc/manuals/debian-faq/ch-ftparchivesThe Debian GNU/Linux FAQChapter 6 - The Debian FTP archivesDebian2013-06-022013-06-03
This naming tradition came about becauseBruce Perenswas involved in the early development of Debian while working atPixar.sfnHertzog20139
article.heading: Blends
article.paragraph: Debian Pure Blendsare subsets of a Debian release configured out-of-the-box for users with particular skills and interests.cite webhttp://blends.debian.org/blends/ch02.html#BlendsDebian Pure BlendsChapter 2. What are Debian Pure Blends?Debian2014-05-27For instance, Debian Jr. is targeted at children, whileDebian Scienceaims at researchers and scientists.cite web//www.debian.org/devel/debian-jr/Debian Jr. ProjectDebian2014-04-302014-06-16The complete Debian distribution includes all available Debian Pure Blends."Debian Blend" (without "Pure") is a term for a Debian-based distribution that strives to become part of mainstream Debian, and have its extra features included in future releases.cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-blends/2011/07/msg00010.htmlRe: Difference between blends and remastered systemsArmstrongBenDebiandebian-blends2011-07-062014-06-16
article.heading: Logo
article.paragraph: The Debian "swirl" logo was designed by Raul Silvacite webhttp://gnuart.onshore.com/GNU/artcite webhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-www/2010/10/msg00119.htmlLogo creditin 1999 as part of a contest to replace the semi-official logo that had been used.cite web//www.debian.org/News/1999/19990204.en.htmlDebian Logo ContestThe winner of the contest received an @debian.orgemail address, as well as a set of Debian 2.1 install CDs for the architecture of their choice. There has been no official statement from the Debian project on the logo's meaning, but at the time of the logo's selection, it was suggested that the logo represented themagic smokethat made computers work.cite webhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-vote/1999/06/msg00001.html[PROPOSED] Swap the "open" and "official" versions of the new logocite webhttp://www.linux.slashdot.org/story/99/06/04/0412213/debian-chooses-logoDebian Chooses Logo

One theory about the origin of the Debian logo is based on an interesting detail:Buzz Lightyear, the chosen character for the first named Debian release, has a swirl in his chin.sfnKrafft200566cite AV mediahttp://www.pixar.com/sites/default/files/ts_billboards_title_v3.jpgToy StoryBillboard[[Pixar]]2014-08-20Stefano Zacchirolialso suggested that this swirl is the Debian one.cite webhttps://upsilon.cc/~zack/talks/2010/20101204-versailles.pdfDebian: 17 ans de logiciel libre, 'do-ocracy' et démocratie6[[Stefano Zacchiroli]]2010-12-042014-10-21
article.heading: Archive areas
article.paragraph: TheDebian Free Software Guidelines(DFSG) define the distinctive meaning of the word "free" as in "free and open-source software".cite web//www.debian.org/social_contractDebian Social ContractDebian2013-06-17Packages which comply with these guidelines, usually under the GNU General Public License,BSD licensesModified BSD LicenseorArtistic License,cite web//www.debian.org/legal/licenses/License informationDebian2009-02-28are included inside theemmainarea;cite web//www.debian.org/doc/manuals/developers-reference/resources.htmlDebian Developer's ReferenceChapter 4. Resources for Debian Developers2008-10-31Debianotherwise, they are included inside theemnon-freeandemcontribareas. These last two areas are not distributed within the official installation media, but they can be adopted manually.

Non-free includes packages which do not comply with the DFSG,cite web//www.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/ch-archive.html#s-sectionsDebian Policy ManualChapter 2 - The Debian ArchiveDebian2013-10-282014-07-09such as documentation with invariant sections andproprietary software,cite web//www.debian.org/vote/2006/vote_001#amendmenttextaGeneral Resolution: Why the GNU Free Documentation License is not suitable for Debian mainDebian20062014-07-02cite webhttps://packages.debian.org/stable/fglrx-driverPackage: fglrx-driver (1:12-6+point-3) [non-free]Debian2014-07-02and legally questionable packages.Contrib includes packages which do comply with the DFSG but fail other requirements; for instance, they may depend on packages which are in non-free or requires such for building them.

Richard Stallmanand theFree Software Foundationhave criticized the Debian project for hosting the non-free repository and because the contrib and non-free areas are easily accessible,cite webhttps://www.gnu.org/philosophy/common-distros.htmlExplaining Why We Don't Endorse Other Systems2014-06-19[[GNU]]cite mailing listhttps://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/gnuherds-app-dev/2007-10/msg00049.htmlRe: Debian vs gNewSense -- FS criteriaStallmanRichardRichard Stallmangnuherds-app-devlists.nongnu.org2007-10-062014-07-09What makes Debian unacceptable is that its inclusion of non-free software is not a mistake.an opinion echoed by some in Debian including the former project leader Wichert Akkerman.cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-vote/1999/06/msg00043.htmldebian-voteMoving contrib and non-free of master.debian.orgAkkermanWichert1999-06-21Debian2014-08-04The internal dissent in the Debian project regarding the non-free section has persisted,cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-vote/2014/03/msg00224.htmlnon-free?WisePauldebian-voteDebian2014-03-222014-08-16but the last time it came to a vote in 2004, the majority decided to keep it.cite web//www.debian.org/vote/2004/vote_002General Resolution: Status of the non-free section20042009-09-28Debian
article.heading: Multimedia support
article.paragraph: Multimedia support has been problematic in Debian regardingcodecsthreatened by possible patent infringements, without sources or under too restrictive licenses,cite webhttps://wiki.debian.org/MultimediaCodecs?actionDiff for 'MultimediaCodecs'MejiaAndresDebian Wiki2012-03-182014-10-16and regarding technologies such asAdobe Flash.cite web//www.debian.org/News/2009/20090214.en.htmlDebian GNU/Linux 5.0 released2009-02-15Debian2009-02-14Even though packages with problems related to their distribution could go into the non-free area, software such aslibdvdcssis not hosted at Debian.cite webhttps://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bugRFP: libdvdcss -- Library to read scrambled DVDsDebian BTS2002-07-252014-07-09

There is a notable third party repository, formerly known as debian-multimedia.org,cite webhttp://www.theregister.co.uk/Print/2009/02/16/debian_lenny_review/'Lenny': Debian for the masses?GilbertsonScott[[The Register]]2009-02-162014-07-13cite webhttp://www.linux-mag.com/id/5006/Cool APT Repositories for Ubuntu and DebianGrannemanScottScott Granneman[[Linux Magazine]]2008-02-062014-07-13cite webhttp://linux.softpedia.com/blog/Window-Maker-Live-CD-2012-03-18-Available-for-Download-259448.shtmlWindow Maker Live CD 2012-03-18 Available for DownloadNestorMarius[[Softpedia]]2012-03-192014-11-22providing software not present in Debian such asWindows APIWindowscodecs, libdvdcss and theAdobe Flash Player.cite webhttp://deb-multimedia.org/pool/main/Packagesdeb-multimedia.org2014-07-13Even though this repository is maintained by Christian Marillat, a Debian developer, it is not part of the project and is not hosted on a Debian server. The repository provides packages already included in Debian, interfering with the official maintenance. Eventually, project leader Stefano Zacchiroli asked Marillat to either settle an agreement about the packaging or to stop using the "Debian" name.cite mailing listhttps://lists.alioth.debian.org/pipermail/pkg-multimedia-maintainers/2012-May/026678.htmlon package duplication between Debian and debian-multimediaZacchiroliStefanoStefano Zacchirolipkg-multimedia-maintainers[[Alioth (Debian)|Alioth]]2012-05-052014-07-13Marillat chose the latter and renamed the repository to deb-multimedia.org. The repository was so popular that the switchover was announced by the official blog of the Debian project.cite webhttps://bits.debian.org/2013/06/remove-debian-multimedia.htmlRemove unofficial debian-multimedia.org repository from your sourcesDebian2013-06-142014-07-13
article.heading: Hardware support
Hardware requirements
article.paragraph: Hardware requirements are at least those of the kernel and theGNUtoolsets. Debian GNU/Linux supportsUniprocessor systemuniprocessorandsymmetric multiprocessor systems.cite web//www.debian.org/releases/wheezy/i386/ch02s01.html.enDebian GNU/Linux Installation Guide2.1. Supported HardwareDebian2013https://web.archive.org/web/20131224224044/http://www.debian.org/releases/wheezy/i386/ch02s01.html.en2013-12-242014-09-25Debian's recommended system requirements depend on the level of installation, which corresponds to increased numbers of installed components:cite web//www.debian.org/releases/wheezy/i386/ch03s04.html.enDebian GNU/Linux Installation Guide3.4. Meeting Minimum Hardware RequirementsDebian2013https://web.archive.org/web/20131224224051/http://www.debian.org/releases/wheezy/i386/ch03s04.html.en2013-12-242014-05-30

The real minimum memory requirements depend on the architecture and may be much less than the numbers listed in this table. It is possible to install Debian with 60 megabyteMBof RAM for x86-64;the installer will run in low memory mode and it is recommended to create aPagingswap partition.The installer forz/Architecturerequires about 20 MB of RAM, but relies on network hardware.cite web//www.debian.org/releases/wheezy/s390/ch05s01.html.enDebian GNU/Linux Installation Guide5.1. Booting the Installer on S/390Debian20132014-09-25Similarly, disk space requirements, which depend on the packages to be installed, can be reduced by manually selecting the packages needed.As of20148, there is no Pure Blend that would lower the hardware requirements easily.cite webhttp://blends.debian.org/blends/ch04.htmlDebian Pure BlendsChapter 4. Existing Debian Pure BlendsDebian2013-06-192014-06-19

It is possible to rungraphical user interfaceson older or low-end systems, but the installation ofwindow managersinstead ofdesktop environmentsis recommended, as desktop environments are more resource-intensive. Requirements for individual software vary widely and must be considered as well as those of the base operating environment.
article.heading: Architecture ports
Official ports
article.paragraph: As of20150426As of the Jessie release, the official ports are:cite webhttps://packages.debian.org/search?keywordsDebian -- Package Search Results -- base-filesDebian2015-04-26

list.listitem: emamd64:x86-64architecture with 64-bit userland and supporting 32-bit software

emarm64: ARMv8-A architecturecite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-devel-announce/2014/08/msg00012.htmlTwo new architectures bootstrapping in unstable - MBF coming soonWookeydebian-devel-announceDebian2014-08-272014-09-01

emarmel: Little-endiannessendianARM architecture(ARMv4T instruction set)cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-embedded/2010/01/msg00057.htmlRe: Identification of ARM chipsWookeydebian-embeddedDebian2010-01-232014-10-16on various embedded systems (EABI)
emarmhf: ARM hard-float architecture (ARMv7 instruction set) requiring hardware with afloating-point unit
emi386:IA-32architecture with 32-bit userland, compatible with x86-64 machines
emmips: Big-endianMIPS architecture
emmipsel: Little-endian MIPS architecture
empowerpc:PowerPCarchitecture
emppc64el: Little-endian PowerPC64 architecture supportingPOWER7POWER7+andPOWER8CPUs

ems390x: z/Architecture with 64-bit userland, intended to replaceems390cite web//www.debian.org/releases/wheezy/s390/release-notes/ch-whats-new.en.html Release Notes for Debian 7.0 (wheezy), S/390 Chapter 2. What's new in Debian 7.0 2014-11-092015-01-28

article.heading: Unofficial ports
article.paragraph: Unofficial ports are available as part of theUnstabledistribution:cite webhttp://www.ports.debian.org/Debian PortsDebian2014-06-20

list.listitem: emalpha:DEC Alphaarchitecture
emhppa: HPPA-RISCarchitecture
emhurd-i386:GNU Hurdkernel onIA-32architecture
emkfreebsd-amd64: Kernel ofFreeBSDon x86-64 architecture
emkfreebsd-i386: Kernel of FreeBSD on IA-32 architecture
emm68k:Motorola 68000 familyMotorola 68karchitecture onAmiga,Atari STAtari,Macintoshand various embeddedVMEbusVMEsystems
empowerpcspe:PowerPC e500PowerPCSPEarchitecture, incompatible withPowerPC
emppc64:Ppc64PowerPC64architecture supporting 64-bit PowerPC CPUs withAltiVecVMX
emsh4: HitachiSuperHarchitecture
emsparc64: SunSPARCarchitecture with 64-bit userland
emx32:x32 ABIuserland for x86-64cite webhttps://wiki.debian.org/X32Port?actionX32PortScheplerDanielDebian Wiki2012-11-202014-10-17

article.heading: anchorEMBEDDEDEmbedded systems
article.paragraph: Debian supports a variety ofARM architectureARM-basednetwork-attached storageNASdevices. TheNSLU2was supported by the installer in Debian 4.0 and 5.0,cite webhttp://linuxgazette.net/161/brownss.htmlUpgrading your Slug LG #161BrownSilas[[Linux Gazette]]2011-07-27andMartin Michlmayris providing installationtar (computing)tarballssince version 6.0.cite webhttp://www.cyrius.com/debian/nslu2/install/Installing Debian on NSLU2[[Martin Michlmayr]]2011-02-242011-07-27Other supported NAS devices are theBuffalo network-attached storage seriesBuffaloKurobox Pro,cite web//www.debian.org/releases/lenny/arm/release-notes/ch-whats-new.en.htmlRelease Notes for Debian GNU/Linux 5.0 (lenny), ARMChapter 2. What's new in Debian GNU/Linux 5.0Debian2011-07-27GLAN Tank, Thecus N2100cite web//www.debian.org/releases/etch/arm/release-notes/ch-whats-new.en.htmlRelease Notes for Debian GNU/Linux 4.0 ('etch'), ARMChapter 2 - What's new in Debian GNU/Linux 4.0Debian2007-08-162011-07-27and QNAP Turbo Stations.

Devices based on the KirkwoodSystem on a chipSoCare supported too, such as theSheevaPlugplug computer and OpenRD products.cite web//www.debian.org/releases/squeeze/armel/release-notes/ch-whats-new.en.html#newforarmRelease Notes for Debian GNU/Linux 6.0 (squeeze), ARM EABIChapter 2. What's new in Debian GNU/Linux 6.0Debian2011-07-27There are efforts to run Debian on mobile devices, but this is not a project goal yet since the Debian Linux kernel maintainers would not apply the necessary patches.cite web//www.debian.org/News/weekly/2012/24/index.en.html#mobilesDebian Project News - December 10th, 2012Debian2012-12-102014-06-17Nevertheless, there are packages for resource-limited systems.cite webhttps://packages.debian.org/wheezy/matchboxPackage: matchbox (1:5)Debian2014-06-17

There are efforts to support Debian onwireless access points.cite webhttps://wiki.debian.org/DebianWRT?actionDebianWRTHessJoeyDebian Wiki2005-09-232014-10-17Debian is known to run on set-top boxes.cite web//www.debian.org/News/weekly/2013/21/#minidebconfsDebian Project News - December 2nd, 2013Debian2013-12-022014-06-17There is an ongoing work to support the AM335x processor,cite webhttps://wiki.debian.org/InstallingDebianOn/TI/BeagleBone?actionInstallingDebianOn TI BeagleBoneLiuYing-ChunDebian Wiki2012-01-272014-10-17which is used inPoint of saleelectronic point of servicesolutions.cite webhttp://www.ti.com/tool/am335x-tabEnterprise Tablet Reference Design Kit[[Texas Instruments]]2014-06-17Debian may be customized to run on cash machines.cite web//krebsonsecurity.com/2014/05/thieves-planted-malware-to-hack-atms/Thieves Planted Malware to Hack ATMs[[Brian Krebs]]2014-05-302014-06-17
BeagleBoard, a low-power open-source hardware single-board computer (Produced by Texas Instruments) has switched to Debian Linux pre-loaded on its Beaglebone Black board's flash.
article.heading: Support for communities
Localization
article.paragraph: Several parts of Debian are translated into languages other than English, including package descriptions, configuration messages, documentation and the website.cite web//www.debian.org/international/l10n/Central Debian translation statisticsDebian2014-07-02The level of software localization depends on the language, ranging from the highly supportedGerman languageGermanandFrench languageFrenchto the hardly translatedMuscogee languageCreekandSamoan languageSamoan.cite web//www.debian.org/international/l10n/po/rankStatus of the l10n in Debian — ranking PO files between languagesDebian2014-07-02The installer is available in 73 languages.cite webhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-devel-announce/2013/05/msg00000.htmlDebian Installer 7.0 RC3 release2013-05-02Debian2013-05-02
article.heading: Virtual communities
article.paragraph: Debian provides packages targeted atVirtual communityvirtual communities. TheFacebookandTwitterapplication interfaces are available to programmers;cite webhttps://packages.debian.org/search?searchonDebian -- Package Search Results -- facebookDebian2014-11-17cite webhttps://packages.debian.org/search?searchonDebian -- Package Search Results -- twitterDebian2014-11-17thePidgin (software)Pidginmessaging client used a custom plugin for Facebook until the networking site added support forXMPP.cite webhttps://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bugRM: pidgin-facebookchat -- RoQA; unneededDebian BTS2013-05-082014-11-17Debian 5.0 Lenny was the last release supportingTencent QQ.cite webhttp://archive.debian.org/debian/pool/main/p/pidgin/libpurple0_2.4.3-4lenny8_i386.deblibpurple0_2.4.3-4lenny8_i386.debDebian2010-11-072014-11-17cite webhttps://packages.debian.org/squeeze/i386/libpurple0/filelistFile list of package libpurple0 in squeeze of architecture i386Debian2014-11-17Communication withSkypeis possible using software in the contrib area.cite webhttps://packages.debian.org/search?searchonDebian -- Package Search Results -- skypeDebian2014-11-17
article.heading: Policies
article.paragraph: Debian is known for its manifesto,cite webhttp://www.theregister.co.uk/Print/2013/08/13/debian_20_birthday/No distro diva drama here: Penguinista favourite Debian turns 20GilbertsonScott[[The Register]]2013-08-132014-05-30social contract,cite webhttp://arstechnica.com/information-technology/2008/12/why-ubuntu-users-should-care-about-debian/Why Ubuntu users should care about DebianPaulRyan[[Ars Technica]]2008-12-302014-05-30cite webhttp://www.networkworld.com/article/2228454/opensource-subnet/why-debian-matters-more-than-ever.htmlWhy Debian matters more than everBrockmeierJoe[[Network World]]2011-02-072014-05-30and policies.cite webhttp://www.pcworld.com/article/165161/trademarks_open_source_friendly.htmlTrademarks: Open Source Friendly (TM)BrockmeierJoe[[PC World]]2009-05-192014-05-30Debian's policies and team efforts focus onCollaborative software development modelcollaborative software development and testing processes.cite webhttp://www.debian.org/doc/manuals/debian-faq/ch-basic_defs.en.html#s-whatisdebianThe Debian GNU/Linux FAQChapter 1 - Definitions and overviewDebian2008-05-12As a result of its policies, a new major release tends to occur every two years with revision releases that fix security issues and important problems.cite bookHertzogRaphaëlThe Debian Administrator's HandbookFreexian2013http://debian-handbook.info/browse/stable/sect.release-lifecycle.html979-10-91414-03-62014-06-22cite web//www.debian.org/News/2009/20090729Debian decides to adopt time-based release freezesDebian2009-09-122009-07-29
article.heading: Organization
article.paragraph: Image frame {{chart/start}} {{chart| | | | | |GR |GRSimplified organizational structure The Debian project is a volunteer organization with three foundational documents:

list.listitem: Theem[[Debian Social Contract]]defines a set of basic principles by which the project and its developers conduct affairs.

Theem[[Debian Free Software Guidelines]]define the criteria for "free software" and thus what software is permissible in the distribution. These guidelines have been adopted as the basis of theThe Open Source DefinitionOpen Source Definition. Although this document can be considered separate, it formally is part of the Social Contract.

TheemDebian Constitutiondescribes the organizational structure for formal decision-making within the project, and enumerates the powers and responsibilities of the Project Leader, the Secretary and other roles.cite webhttp://www.debian.org/devel/constitutionConstitution for the Debian Project (v1.4)2014-02-25Debian

article.paragraph: Debian developers are organized in aweb of trust.sfnColeman2013143There areas of2014at presentabout one thousand active Debian developers,cite webhttps://nm.debian.org/public/people/dd_uDebian New Member - Status DD, upl.Debian2014-06-21cite webhttps://nm.debian.org/public/people/dd_nuDebian New Member - Status DD, non-upl.Debian2014-06-21but it is possible to contribute to the project without being an official developer.cite web//www.debian.org/intro/helpHow can you help Debian?Debian2014-04-302014-06-03

The project maintains officialmailing listsand conferences for communication and coordination between developers.cite webhttp://meetings-archive.debian.net/pub/debian-meetings/Index of /pub/debian-meetingsDebian2014-07-16For issues with single packages and other tasks,cite web//www.debian.org/Bugs/pseudo-packagesDebian bug tracking system pseudo-packagesDebian2013-12-082014-06-03a publicSoftware bugbugtracking system is used by developers and end users.Internet Relay Chatchannels (primarily on theOpen and Free Technology CommunityOFTCandfreenodenetworks) are also used for communication among developersand to provide real time help.cite web//www.debian.org/support#ircSupportDebian2014-04-302014-06-03

Debian is supported by donations made to organizations authorized by the leader.The largest supporter isSoftware in the Public Interest, the owner of the Debian trademark, manager of the monetary donationscite web//www.debian.org/donationsDonations to Software in the Public InterestDebian2014-05-102014-06-03andumbrella organizationfor various other community free software projects.cite webhttp://www.spi-inc.org/projects/SPI Associated Projects[[Software in the Public Interest]]2014-07-142014-07-16

A Project Leader is elected once per year by the developers. The leader has special powers, but they are not absolute, and appoints delegates to perform specialized tasks. Delegates make decisions as they think is best, taking into account technical criteria and consensus. By way of a General Resolution, the developers may recall the leader, reverse a decision made by the leader or a delegate, amend foundational documents and make other binding decisions.The voting method is based on theSchulze methodCloneproof Schwartz Sequential Dropping.cite web//www.debian.org/vote/Debian Voting InformationDebian2014-02-182014-06-03

Project leadership is distributed occasionally. Branden Robinson was helped by the ProjectScud (dog)Scud, a team of developers that assisted the leader,cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-project/2005/03/msg00035.htmlAnnouncing project scudvan WolffelaarJeroendebian-projectDebian2005-03-052014-07-17but there were concerns that such leadership would split Debian into two developer classes.sfnKrafft200534Anthony Towns created a supplemental position, Second In Charge (2IC), that shared some powers of the leader.cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-devel-announce/2006/04/msg00015.htmlBits from the DPLTownsAnthonydebian-devel-announceDebian2006-04-232014-07-17Steve McIntyre was 2IC and had a 2IC himself.cite web//www.debian.org/vote/2009/platforms/93samSteve McIntyre's DPL platform, 2009Debian2014-07-17

One important role in Debian's leadership is that of asoftware release life cyclereleasemanager.cite webhttp://www.business.ualberta.ca/tcc/documents/TII_3_OMahoney_Ferraro_final.pdfThe Emergence of Governance in an Open Source Community30SiobhánO'MahonyFerraroFabrizio[[University of Alberta School of Business]]2008-11-012007http://web.archive.org/web/20080529081303/http://www.business.ualberta.ca/tcc/documents/TII_3_OMahoney_Ferraro_final.pdf2008-05-29The release team sets goals for the next release, supervises the processes and decides when to release. The team is led by the next release managers and stable release managers.cite webhttp://www.debian.org/intro/organizationThe Debian organization web page2008-11-01DebianRelease assistants were introduced in 2003.cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-devel-announce/2003/03/msg00007.htmlBits from the RM: Help Wanted, Apply WithinTownsAnthonydebian-devel-announceDebian2003-03-082014-07-17
article.heading: Developer recruitment, motivation, and resignation
article.paragraph: The Debian project has an influx of applicants wishing to become developers.cite webhttps://nm.debian.org/public/stats/Debian New Member - StatisticsDebian2014-06-03These applicants must undergo a vetting process which establishes their identity, motivation, understanding of the project's principles, and technical competence.cite webhttp://www.debian.org/devel/join/newmaintDebian New MaintainersDebian2008-10-31This process has become much harder throughout the years.sfnHertzog201313
Debian developers join the project for a number of reasons; some that have been cited include:

list.listitem: Debian is their main operating system and they want to promote Debiancite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-newmaint/2009/01/msg00022.htmlAM report for Alexander GQ GerasiovBergChristophdebian-newmaintDebian2009-01-102014-07-18

To improve the support for their favorite technologycite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-newmaint/2010/01/msg00000.htmlAM report for Jakub Wilk [...]JoerisSteffendebian-newmaintDebian2010-01-032014-07-18
They are involved with a Debian derivativecite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-newmaint/2011/01/msg00005.htmlAM report for Kamal MostafaWolfGunnardebian-newmaintDebian2011-01-132014-07-18

A desire to contribute back to thefree-software communitycite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-newmaint/2012/01/msg00001.htmlAM report for vichoFaraoneLukedebian-newmaintDebian2012-01-012014-07-18

To make their Debian maintenance work easiercite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-newmaint/2013/01/msg00004.htmlAM report for Manuel A. Fernandez MonteceloWiltshireJonathandebian-newmaintDebian2013-01-062014-07-18

article.paragraph: Debian developers may resign their positions at any time or, when deemed necessary, they can be expelled.Those who follow the retiring protocol are granted the "emeritus" status and they may regain their membership through a shortened new member process.cite web//www.debian.org/doc/manuals/developers-reference/developer-duties.htmlDebian Developer's ReferenceChapter 3. Debian Developer's DutiesDebian2014-07-19
article.heading: Development procedures

paragraph.xhtml:div: Flowchart of the life cycle of a Debian package

article.paragraph: Each software package has aemmaintainerthat may be either one person or a team of Debian developers and non-developer maintainers.cite web//www.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/ch-binary.htmlDebian Policy ManualChapter 3 - Binary packagesDebian2013-10-282014-07-19cite webhttp://www.debian.org/vote/2007/vote_00320072008-12-13General Resolution: Endorse the concept of Debian MaintainersDebianThe maintainer keeps track ofupstream (software development)upstreamreleases, and ensures that the package coheres with the rest of the distribution and meets the standards of quality of Debian. Packages may include modifications introduced by Debian to achieve compliance with Debian Policy, even to fix non-Debian specific bugs, although coordination with upstream developers is advised.

The maintainer releases a new version by uploading the package to the "incoming" system, which verifies the integrity of the packages and theirdigital signatures. If the package is found to be valid, it is installed in the package archive into an area called the "pool" and distributed every day to hundreds ofWeb mirrormirrorsworldwide. The upload must be signed usingOpenPGP-compatible software.All Debian developers have individualPublic-key cryptographycryptographic key pairs.cite web//www.debian.org/doc/manuals/developers-reference/new-maintainer.html#registering2010-10-09Debian Developer's ReferenceChapter 2. Applying to Become a MaintainerDebianDevelopers are responsible for any package they upload even if the packaging was prepared by another contributor.cite webhttps://wiki.debian.org/DebianMentorsFaq?actionDebianMentorsFaqCostelaLeoDebian Wiki2010-02-122014-10-17

Initially, an accepted package is only available in theUnstablebranch.For a package to become a candidate for the next release, it must migrate to theTestingbranch by meeting the following:cite web//www.debian.org/doc/manuals/developers-reference/pkgs.html#testing2008-10-31Debian Developer's ReferenceChapter 5. Managing PackagesDebian

list.listitem: It has been inUnstablefor a certain length of time that depends on the urgency of the changes.
It does not have "release-critical" bugs, except for the ones already present inTesting. Release-critical bugs are those considered serious enough that they make the package unsuitable for release.
There are no outdated versions inUnstablefor any release ports.
The migration does not break any packages inTesting.
Its dependencies can be satisfied by packages already inTestingor by packages being migrated at the same time.
The migration is not blocked by a freeze.

article.paragraph: Thus, a release-critical bug in a new version of a shared library on which many packages depend may prevent those packages from enteringTesting, because the updated library must meet the requirements too.cite webhttp://www.debian.org/devel/testing2008-11-24Debian 'testing' distributionDebianFrom the branch viewpoint, the migration process happens twice per day, renderingTestinginperpetual beta.

Periodically, the release team publishes guidelines to the developers in order to ready the release. A new release occurs after a freeze, when all important software is reasonably up-to-date in theTestingbranch and any other significant issues are solved. At that time, all packages in theTestingbranch become the newStablebranch.Although freeze dates are time-based,release dates are not, which are announced by the release managers a couple of weeks beforehand.cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-devel-announce/2013/04/msg00006.htmlFINAL release updateMcGovernNeildebian-devel-announceDebian2013-04-182014-07-20

A version of a package can belong to more than one branch, usuallyTestingandUnstable. It is possible for a package to keep the same version between stable releases and be part ofOldstable,Stable,TestingandUnstableat the same time.cite webhttps://packages.debian.org/search?keywordsDebian -- Package Search Results -- dict-bouvierDebian2014-06-04Each branch can be seen as a collection of pointers into the package "pool" mentioned above.
article.heading: Security
article.paragraph: The Debian project handles security throughFull disclosure (computer security)public disclosurerather than throughsecurity through obscurityobscurity. Debian security advisories are compatible with theCommon Vulnerabilities and Exposuresdictionary, are usually coordinated with other free software vendors and are published the same day a vulnerability is made public.cite webhttp://www.debian.org/security/2008-12-13Security InformationDebiancite webhttps://cve.mitre.org/compatible/organizations.html#Software%20in%20the%20Public%20Interest,%20Inc.Organizations Participating[[Mitre Corporation|MITRE]]2014-04-162014-06-05There used to be a security audit project that focused on packages in the stable release looking for security bugs;cite web//www.debian.org/security/audit/Debian Security Audit ProjectDebian2014-03-152014-06-04Steve Kemp, who started the project, retired in 2011 but resumed his activities and applied to rejoin in 2014.cite webhttp://www.steve.org.uk/Security/Advisories/AdvisoriesSteve Kemp2014-08-18cite webhttps://nm.debian.org/public/person/skxSteve KempDebian2014-08-18

TheStablebranch is supported by the Debian security team;Oldstableis supported for one year.cite webhttp://www.debian.org/security/faqDebian security FAQ2007-02-282008-10-21DebianAlthough Squeeze is not officially supported, Debian is coordinating an effort to providelong-term supportuntil February 2016, five years after the initial release, but only for the IA-32 and x86-64 platforms.cite webhttp://www.phoronix.com/scan.php?pageDebian To Maintain 6.0 Squeeze As An LTS ReleaseLarabelMichaelMichael Larabel[[Phoronix]]2014-04-182014-07-21Testingis supported by theTestingsecurity team, but does not receive updates in as timely a manner asStable.cite webhttp://testing-security.debian.netDebian testing security teamDebian2008-10-31Unstable's security is left for the package maintainers.

The Debian project offers documentation and tools tohardening (computing)hardena Debian installation both manually and automatically.cite webhttp://www.debian.org/doc/user-manuals#securing2008-12-13Securing Debian ManualDebianSecurity-Enhanced LinuxandAppArmorsupport is available but disabled by default.Debian provides an optional hardening wrapper, and does not harden all of its software by default usingGNU Compiler Collectiongccfeatures such asPosition-independent codePIEandbuffer overflow protection, unlike operating systems such asOpenBSD,cite webhttp://d-sbd.alioth.debian.org/www/Debian Secure by DefaultDebian: SbD2011-01-31but tries to build as many packages as possible with hardening flags.
article.heading: 2008 OpenSSL vulnerability
article.paragraph: In May 2008, it was revealed that a Debian developer discovered that theOpenSSLpackage distributed with Debian and derivatives such asUbuntu (operating system)Ubuntu, made a variety of security keys vulnerable to arandom number generator attack, since only 32,767 different keys were generated.cite webhttp://www.debian.org/security/2008/dsa-1571DSA-1571-1 openssl: predictable random number generator2008-05-132008-10-31Debiancite webhttp://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?nameCVE-2008-01662014-07-21[[Mitre Corporation|MITRE]]cite webhttp://www.technologyreview.com/news/410159/alarming-open-source-security-holes/Alarming Open-Source Security HolesGarfinkelSimsonSimson Garfinkel[[MIT Technology Review]]2008-05-202014-07-21The security weakness was caused by changes made in 2006 by another Debian developer in response to memory debugger warnings.cite webhttps://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bugvalgrind-clean the RNGDebian BTS2006-04-192014-06-21The complete resolution procedure was cumbersome because patching the security hole was not enough; it involved regenerating all affected keys and certificates.cite webhttp://cseweb.ucsd.edu/~hovav/dist/debiankey.pdfWhen Private Keys are Public: Results from the 2008 Debian OpenSSL Vulnerability[[University of California, San Diego]]20092014-06-22Being introduced by Debian, the vulnerability caused anger and embarrassment among Debian developers.cite webhttp://blog.technologeek.org/2008/05/13/107Making code valgrind-clean …Julien Blache2008-05-13https://web.archive.org/web/20080725025839/http://blog.technologeek.org/2008/05/13/1072008-07-252014-06-21cite webhttp://www.lucas-nussbaum.net/blog/?pNo, we don’t need a new openssl maintainerLucas Nussbaum2008-05-132014-06-21
article.heading: Derivatives
article.paragraph: Debian GNU/Linux is one of the most popular Linux distributions, and manyDebian familyother distributionshave been created from the Debian codebase, including Ubuntu andKnoppix.cite webhttp://www.linux-mag.com/id/7651/The Five Distros That Changed LinuxVaughan-NicholsSteven J.[[Linux Magazine]]2009-12-162013-02-14As of2014,DistroWatchlists 135 active Debian derivatives.cite webhttp://distrowatch.com/search.php?ostypeBased on Debian, status active[[DistroWatch]]2014-08-16The Debian project provides its derivatives with guidelines for best practices and encourages derivatives to merge their work back into Debian.cite webhttps://wiki.debian.org/Derivatives/Guidelines?actionDerivatives GuidelinesHalchenkoYaroslavDebian Wiki2010-12-212014-10-17sfnHertzog2013429A sign of cooperation with Ubuntu can be seen in the Debian package tracker.cite webhttps://tracker.debian.org/pkg/base-filesbase-filesDebian2014-07-13
article.heading: History
Release timeline
article.paragraph: Debian has made thirteen major stable releases:cite web//www.debian.org/doc/manuals/project-history/ch-releases.en.htmlA Brief History of DebianChapter 3 - Debian ReleasesDebian2013-05-042014-06-22

article.heading: Birth (19931998)
article.paragraph: Debian was first announced on August 16, 1993, byIan Murdock, who initially called the system "the Debian Linux Release".cite web//www.debian.org/doc/manuals/project-history/ch-intro.en.htmlA Brief History of DebianChapter 1 - Introduction -- What is the Debian Project?Debian2013-05-042014-06-22cite newsgroupNew release under development; suggestions requestedhttps://groups.google.com/forum/#!original/comp.os.linux.development/Md3Modzg5TU/xty88y5OLaMJCBusDD.MIK@unix.portal.comMurdockIan A.Ian Murdock1993-08-16comp.os.linux.development2012-06-13The word "Debian" was formed as aportmanteaucombinationof the first name of his then-girlfriend Debra Lynn and his own first name.cite bookNixon Robin Ubuntu: Up and Running 3 [[O'Reilly Media]] 2010 978-0-596-80484-8 http://books.google.com/books?id2014-06-22 Prior to Debian's release, theSoftlanding Linux System(SLS) had been a popular Linux distribution and the basis forSlackware.cite webDebian and the grass roots of Linuxhttp://www.itpro.co.uk/135084/debian-and-the-grass-roots-of-linuxHillesleyRichardIT Pro2007-11-022014-05-25The perceived poor maintenance and prevalence ofsoftware bugbugsin SLS motivated Murdock to launch a new distribution.sfnScheetz199817

Debian 0.01, released on September 15, 1993, was the first of several internal releases.cite webhttp://www.ibiblio.org/pub/historic-linux/distributions/debian-0.91/ChangeLogChangeLog[[ibiblio]]2014-07-03Version 0.91 was virtually the first public release,sfnScheetz199818providing support through mailing lists hosted at Pixar.cite webhttp://www.ibiblio.org/pub/historic-linux/distributions/debian-0.91/debian-0.91/RELEASE-0.91RELEASE-0.91[[ibiblio]]1994-01-312014-07-03The release included the Debian Linux Manifesto, outlining Murdock's view for the newoperating system. In it he called for the creation of a distribution to be maintained openly, in the spirit of Linux and GNU.cite webhttp://www.ibiblio.org/pub/historic-linux/distributions/debian-0.91/info/ManifestoThe Debian Linux ManifestoMurdockIan A.Ian Murdock[[ibiblio]]1994-01-062014-07-17

The Debian project released the 0.9x versions in 1994 and 1995.During this time it was sponsored by theFree Software Foundationfor one year.cite newsgrouphttps://groups.google.com/forum/#!original/comp.os.linux.misc/A30TG4KRx4Y/WKi_Yx0iuTAJThe FSF is no longer sponsoring Debiangnusenet199604280427.AAA00388@delasyd.gnu.ai.mit.eduStallmanRichardRichard Stallmancomp.os.linux.misc1996-04-282014-08-22Ian Murdock delegated the base system, the core packages of Debian, to Bruce Perens and Murdock focused on the management of the growing project.sfnScheetz199818The first ports to non-IA-32architectures began in 1995, and Debian 1.1 was released in 1996.cite web//www.debian.org/doc/manuals/project-history/ch-detailed.en.htmlA Brief History of DebianChapter 4 - A Detailed HistoryDebian2013-05-042014-08-01By that time and thanks toIan Jackson, the dpkg package manager was already an essential part of Debian.sfnKrafft200531–32

In 1996, Bruce Perens assumed the project leadership. Perens was a controversial leader, regarded as authoritarian and strongly attached to Debian.sfnHertzog20139He drafted asocial contractand edited suggestions from a month-long discussion into the Debian Social Contract and the Debian Free Software Guidelines.cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-announce/1997/msg00017.htmlDebian's 'Social Contract' with the Free Software CommunityPerensBruceBruce Perensdebian-announceDebian1997-07-052014-08-01After the FSF withdrew their sponsorship in the midst of theFree and open-source softwarefree software vs. open source debate,cite webhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-devel/1999/02/msg01641.htmlIt's Time to Talk About Free Software AgainPerens initiated the creation of the legalumbrella organizationSoftware in the Public Interestinstead of seeking renewed involvement with the FSF.He led the conversion of the project froma.outtoExecutable and Linkable FormatELF.sfnScheetz199819He created theBusyBoxprogram to make it possible to run a Debian installer on a single floppy, and wrote a new installer.cite webhttp://www.linuxjournal.com/article/4335Building Tiny Linux Systems with Busybox--Part IPerensBruceBruce Perens[[Linux Journal]]2000-11-012014-06-05By the time Debian 1.2 was released, the project had grown to nearly two hundred volunteers.sfnScheetz199819Perens left the project in 1998.cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-user/1998/03/msg01628.htmlI am leaving DebianPerensBruceBruce PerensDebiandebian-user1998-03-182014-06-05

Ian Jackson became the leader in 1998.cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-announce/1997/msg00037.htmlIan Jackson is the next Debian Project LeaderPerensBruceBruce Perensdebian-announceDebian1997-12-012014-08-02Debian 2.0 introduced the second official port,Motorola 68000 familym68k.During this time the first port to a non-Linux kernel,Debian GNU/Hurd, was started.cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-hurd/1998/07/msg00000.htmldebian-hurd@lists.debian.org is up!GrobmanIgordebian-hurdDebian1998-07-142014-08-02On December 2, the first Debian Constitution was ratified.
article.heading: Leader election (19992005)
article.paragraph: From 1999, the project leader was elected yearly.TheAdvanced Packaging Toolwas deployed with Debian 2.1.The amount of applicants was overwhelming and the project established the new member process.sfnColeman2013141cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-project/1999/10/msg00003.htmlNew maintainer proposalAkkermanWichertdebian-projectDebian1999-10-172014-08-02The first Debian derivatives, namelyLibranet,cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-commercial/1999/msg00006.htmlNew Linux distribution brings Debian to the desktop.LohnerNilsdebian-commercialDebian1999-11-092014-08-02Corel LinuxandStormix's Storm Linux, were started in 1999.The 2.2 release in 2000 was dedicated to Joel Klecker, a developer who died ofDuchenne muscular dystrophy.cite web//www.debian.org/News/2000/20000815Debian GNU/Linux 2.2, the 'Joel "Espy" Klecker' release, is officially releasedDebian2000-08-152011-07-27

In late 2000, the project reorganized the archive with new package "pools" and created theTestingdistribution, made up of packages considered stable, to reduce the freeze for the next release.In the same year, developers began holding an annual conference calledDebConfwith talks and workshops for developers and technical users.cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-devel-announce/2000/05/msg00006.htmlFirst Debian Conference : the programLarondeThierrydebian-devel-announceDebian2000-05-152014-08-02In May 2001,Hewlett-Packardannounced plans to base its Linux development on Debian.cite webhttp://news.cnet.com/HP-settles-on-Debian-Linux/2100-1001_3-257405.htmlHP settles on Debian LinuxLemosRobert[[CNET|CNET News]]2001-05-102014-08-19

In July 2002, the project released version 3.0, code-named Woody, the first release to include cryptographic software, a free licensed KDE andInternationalization and localizationinternationalization.sfnKrafft200533During these last release cycles, the Debian project drew considerable criticism from the free software community because of the long time between stable releases.cite webhttp://www.theregister.co.uk/2002/07/23/debian_gnu_linux/Debian GNU/Linux 3.0 releasedLetticeJohn[[The Register]]2002-07-232014-08-19cite webhttp://www.zdnet.com/debian-leaders-faster-release-cycle-required-1139185097/Debian leaders: Faster release cycle requiredLeMayRenai[[ZDNet]]2005-03-182014-08-03cite webhttp://ianmurdock.com/debian/ubuntu-vs-debian-reprise/Ubuntu vs. Debian, reprise[[Ian Murdock]]2005-04-202014-06-05

Some events disturbed the project while working on Sarge, as Debian servers were attacked by fire and hackers.cite webhttp://www.theregister.co.uk/2003/12/02/hackers_used_unpatched_server/Hackers used unpatched server to breach DebianOrlowskiAndrewAndrew Orlowski[[The Register]]2003-12-022014-08-03One of the most memorable was the Vancouver prospectus.sfnColeman2013150cite webhttp://www.theregister.co.uk/2005/03/14/debian_reduced/Debian drops mainframe, Sparc developmentOrlowskiAndrewAndrew Orlowski[[The Register]]2005-03-142014-08-03cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-devel-announce/2005/08/msg00009.htmlResults of the meeting in Helsinki about the Vancouver proposalVerhelstWouterdebian-devel-announceDebian2005-08-212014-08-03After a meeting held inVancouver, release manager Steve Langasek announced a plan to reduce the number of supported ports to four in order to shorten future release cycles.cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-devel-announce/2005/03/msg00012.htmlBits (Nybbles?) from the Vancouver release team meetingLangasekStevedebian-devel-announceDebian2005-03-142014-08-03There was a large reaction because the proposal looked more like a decision and because such a drop would damage Debian's aim to be "the universal operating system".sfnColeman2013153–154cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-devel/2005/03/msg00712.htmlRe: Bits (Nybbles?) from the Vancouver release team meetingJarnoAuréliendebian-develDebian2005-03-142014-08-03cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-devel/2005/03/msg00761.htmlRe: Bits (Nybbles?) from the Vancouver release team meetingBlacheJuliendebian-develDebian2005-03-142014-08-03
article.heading: Sarge release (2005present)
article.paragraph: File:Debian Etch-ja.pngthumb250pxDebian 4.0 Etch (2007)The 3.1 Sarge release was made in June 2005. This release updated 73% of the software and included over 9,000 new packages. A new installer with a modular design,Debian-Installer, allowed installations withRAID,XFSandLogical Volume Manager (Linux)LVMsupport, improved hardware detection, made installations easier for novice users, and was translated into almost forty languages. An installation manual and release notes were in ten and fifteen languages respectively. The efforts ofSkolelinux,Debian-Medand Debian-Accessibility raised the number of packages that were educational, had a medical affiliation, and ones made for people with disabilities.cite webhttp://www.debian.org/releases/sarge/i386/release-notes/ch-whats-new.en.htmlRelease Notes for Debian GNU/Linux 3.1 (`sarge'), Intel x86Chapter 2 - What's new in Debian GNU/Linux 3.1Debian2006-09-182010-08-05

File:Iceweasel icon.svgthumb64pxleftIceweasellogoIn 2006, as a result of a much-publicized dispute,Mozilla Corporation software rebranded by the Debian projectMozilla software was rebranded in Debian, withFirefoxbecoming Iceweasel andMozilla ThunderbirdThunderbirdbecoming Icedove. The Mozilla Corporation stated that software with unapproved modifications could not be distributed under the Firefox trademark. Two reasons that Debian modifies the Firefox software are to change the non-free artwork and to provide security patches.cite webhttp://archive09.linux.com/feature/57675[[Linux.com]]Behind the Debian and Mozilla dispute over use of Firefox2006-10-10LisaHoover2009-02-09cite mailing listhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-devel/2006/10/msg00665.htmlRe: Will IceWeasel be based on a fork or on vanilla FireFox?SanchezRoberto C.debian-develDebian2006-10-152014-08-03

A fund-raising experiment, Dunc-Tank, was created to solve the release cycle problem and release managers were paid to work full-time;cite webhttp://www.dunc-tank.org/press.htmlPress InformationDunc-Tank2006-09-19https://web.archive.org/web/20061010082200/http://www.dunc-tank.org/press.html2006-10-102014-08-24in response, unpaid developers slowed down their work and the release was delayed.cite webhttp://www.eweek.com/c/a/Linux-and-Open-Source/Disgruntled-Debian-Developers-Delay-Etch/Disgruntled Debian Developers Delay EtchVaughan-NicholsSteven J.[[eWeek]]2006-12-182014-08-24Debian 4.0 (Etch) was released in April 2007, featuring the x86-64 port and a graphical installer.Debian 5.0 (Lenny) was released in February 2009, supporting Marvell'sOrion (system-on-a-chip)Orionplatform and netbooks such as theAsus Eee PC.The release was dedicated to Thiemo Seufer, a developer who died in a car accident.cite web//www.debian.org/releases/lenny/i386/release-notes/apc.en.htmlRelease Notes for Debian GNU/Linux 5.0 (lenny), Intel x86Appendix C. Lenny dedicated to Thiemo Seufer2014-05-25Debian2009-02-14

In July 2009, the policy of time-based development freezes on a two-year cycle was announced. Time-based freezes are intended to blend the predictability of time based releases with Debian's policy of feature based releases, and to reduce overall freeze time.The Squeeze cycle was going to be especially short; however, this initial schedule was abandoned.cite webhttp://www.debian.org/News/2009/20090730Debian GNU/Linux 6.0 'Squeeze' release goalsDebian2009-12-012009-07-30In September 2010, thebackportingbackportsservice became official, providing more recent versions of some software for the stable release.

Debian 6.0 (Squeeze) was released in February 2011, introduced Debian GNU/kFreeBSD as a technology preview, featured a dependency-based boot system, and moved problematic firmware to the non-free area.Debian 7.0 (Wheezy) was released in May 2013, featuring multiarch supportand Debian 8.0 (Jessie) was released in April 2015, usingsystemdas the new init system.cite webhttp://www.debian.org/News/2015/20150426Debian 8 'Jessie' Released2015-04-252015-10-27DebianAs of2014At present, Debian is still in development and new packages are uploaded toUnstableevery day.cite webhttps://lists.debian.org/debian-devel-changes/Unstable packages' upgrade announcementsDebian2014-11-19

Throughout Debian's lifetime, both the Debian distribution and its website have won various awards from different organizations,cite webAwardshttp://www.debian.org/misc/awardsDebian2008-11-02includingServer Distribution of the Year2011,cite webhttp://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/linux-news-59/2011-linuxquestions-org-members-choiceright-award-winners-928502/#post45981952011 LinuxQuestions.org Members Choice Award Winners[[LinuxQuestions.org]]2012-02-092014-06-06The best Linux distro of 2011,cite webhttp://www.tuxradar.com/content/best-distro-2011The best Linux distro of 2011![[TuxRadar]]2011-08-042014-06-06and aBest of the Netaward for October 1998.cite webhttp://linux.miningco.com/library/awards/bloct98.htmBest of the Net Awards, October 1998 - Focus On Linux[[The Mining Company]]1999-05-04https://web.archive.org/web/19990504092128/http://linux.miningco.com/library/awards/bloct98.htm1999-05-042014-06-06
